TopicTitle: SpaceX to reveal their manned DragonV2 capsule tonight

Articles.Content: Cool, thought it was just my phone.
I'm on mobile to so maybe. Though I doubt we would just get the marque if there was a problem.

Oh dayum, it has started!

EDIT: I'll be updating this post.

That's one sexy spaceship!

Apparently, they're using "printed" engines, and they'll keep the parachutes in the ship for emergencies.

Edited May 30, 2014 by astropapi1
Looks like something out of a sci-fi movie! Great job SpaceX!
Darn, I can't wait for the first landing of this IRL! Will be epic!
First printed rocket engine! Wow!

First printed rocket engine! Wow!

First to fly, not first ever.
Haha I called it. The only things with buttons are the emergency controls and the joystick for flight. Now the question is when can Jeb get one? lmao

First to fly, not first ever.

Thanks for correcting.
Someone needs to make that control panel for KSP.
As for the ship I was very surprised and taken back, very nice looking ship and has good potential. Also anyone notice the solar bullet trunk.
Finally. A rocket for the 21st century!

Darn cool stuff, the control screens looked like they wouldn't be out of place in a Tesla! On that note, me and a friend joked about them sending a Model S to space, and here SpaceX is, doing just that!

I really liked the "stupidly fast stairs" part, where Elon seemed to be like "Ok here we go, I'm just gonna walk all casually into my new spaceship. Nothing out of the ordinary here."
I just had a complete nerdgasm. Rear "fairing" cylinder IS the solar array. Wow.
They won't notice if I sneak on board during the first unmanned test of that thing, will they?

As for the ship I was very surprised and taken back, very nice looking ship and has good potential. Also anyone notice the solar bullet trunk.

Huh? Not sure what you are talking about.
That thing is was Gorgeous! Powered landing as the 21st Century return landing system!

Huh? Not sure what you are talking about.

In the animation, the new trunk has solar cells embedded into it instead of panels.

In the animation, the new trunk has solar cells embedded into it instead of panels.

Ahh yea. I did notice it, and wondered what it was for. But he did say "survive for days" must be only jettisoned right before reentry and that's how they get power to survive.

The ship just looks even more fantastic than I had expected! The two things that I wasn't expecting though was their concept of reusing the docking port cover as well as what appeared to be a new body for the rear/service module/Whatever section (The non reusable solar cell bit). Awsome work SpaceX!!!

Someone needs to make that control panel for KSP.

We should get squad to give us a capsule that looks a bit like the new Spacex one that had built in landing rockets and maybe a crew of about 5! With that fantastic control panel of course. 1000 science point parts anyone?

Edited May 30, 2014 by DerpenWolf
Nothing that sexy can fly! Did you see the control panel? I think I did but my memory is shot because I entered an epileptic seizure from the awesomeness of it all.
So does someone know when we will see the pad/flight abort tests?

So does someone know when we will see the pad/flight abort tests?

Last scheduled for sometime in June and ate summer, respectively.We'll see.

Oh my Jebediah, that vehicle is... sexy. Ã¢â‚¬â€¹Can't wait to see that beast fly!

...so when can I expect a mod version of this for KSP?

...so when can I expect a mod version of this for KSP?

There is bound to be one available in 6 hours. Kind of fun to look at the old ones and see how well they compare.
